titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Town of East Hampton land patent 1973.160
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor:
This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.
Revised and expanded description of this collection was made possible thanks to the generosity of The Robert David Lion Gardiner Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-03-21 16:01:27 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Town of East Hampton land patent
did.abstract: One land patent, dated 1686, for the Town of East Hampton in Long Island, N.Y. The patent, granted and written by Thomas Dougan, General Governor in Chief and Vice Admiral of the Province of New York, gives land belonging to the Montauk people to several European settlers.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1973.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The European settlement of the Town of East Hampton in Long Island was undertaken in 1648 by a group of English Puritan families who had initially migrated from England to the colonies of Connecticut and Massachusetts. The settlers purchased the town land, comprising 31,000 acres and belonging to the Montaukett Tribe, from the Connecticut and Massachusetts governors. In 1664, East Hampton became part of the province of New York, later to become New York State.

list.head: Source:
list.item: Town of East Hampton. "Town of East Hampton History." Accessed April 18, 2011. http://www.town.east-hampton.ny.us/HtmlPages/TownofEastHamptonHistory.htm

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Town of East Hampton land patent, 1686, 1973.160, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was revised by Dee Bowers in 2025. Portions of the revised description were written by Cecilia Wright as part of a project to assess and improve access to archival collections in CBH's holdings that relate to Long Island, made possible thanks to the generosity of The Robert David Lion Gardiner Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One land patent, dated 1686, for the Town of East Hampton in Long Island, N.Y. The patent, granted and written by Thomas Dougan, General Governor in Chief and Vice Admiral of the Province of New York, awards the land title to Thomas Baker, Thomas Chatfield, Jeremiah Conklin, Stephen Hedges, John Mulford, John Osborn, and Thomas Osborn. This land granted by Dougan belonged to the Montauk people.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain.

While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
